result.execSummary:
The defendant David W Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **CORRECTED 8-6-2015:  To reflect that defendant is not eligible for ERP/CIP and to add 5% restitution surcharge.**
Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay restitution during the pendancy of probation or a civil Judgment will be entered against him.

Defendant must pay court costs and the cost of supervision.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample and pay for the testing.
  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.
Firearms warning given.
Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights are restored.
No controlled substances or alcohol or unvarified prescriptions. The defendant must sign a release for the agent to have access to medical records and defendant can't fill a prescription without the agents approval.
Defendant must become involved in and successfully complete Veterans Treatment Court.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1 with the same conditions as count 1.
Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined in probation conditions.

State recommends:  2 yrs wps and 3 yrs ES I&S   2 yrs prob.  no contact with victim, rest: $1,100 to MK. and $1,450 to GK., 90 days RCJ: 45 serve and 45 stayed cons. to revo.  Defendant has completed serving the revocation.
P-G to Cts 1 and 2 and found G by the court  Judge conducts plea colloquey.   Back on the Record:  Defendant is given a 4 page Veterans Treatment Court contract and reviews it with his attorney and signs it.  Must successfully completes Veterans Treatment Court program as a condition of probation.  In custody since 2/4/15.  Defendant will go straight to Spring Place Manor.  Should receive CFTS from July 20, 2015.
